document_data.mainbody:
Farsea Marshwine was a variety of red wine, produced in the Farsea Swamp of Cormyr. It was exported as far as the Western Heartlands, the lands along the River Chionthar, and the city of Baldurs Gate, as of the late 15 century DR.
Farsea Marshwine was a sweet and bitter red. Some described its watery taste as if its been thrown overboard. This wine was sold in thin and long tan-colored bottles.
*Danzo Arkwright, the proprietor of the Sword Coast Couriers mail service based out of Rivington district of Baldurs Gate in the late 15 century DR.
